info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...An area of snow will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, south central Teton and west central Cascade Counties through 100 PM MST... At 1055 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of snow moving slowly westward over western Cascade County and the eastern portions of Lewis and Clark County. This area of snow was moving to the west around 15 mph. HAZARD...Snow, with reduced visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...New snow accumulations will range from about a half inch around Wolf Creek, Craig and Dearborn to around 1 inch near Augusta and Rogers Pass through 1 PM. Locations impacted include... Cascade, Augusta, Wolf Creek, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park, Craig, Dearborn, Nilan Reservoir, and Bean Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Plan on slippery roadways and areas of reduced visibility.
